title: How to Make Pelmini (Russian Dumplings)

steps.headline: To make the dough, combine the flour, eggs, water and a 1/2 teaspoon salt.
Mix the ground beef, ground pork, chopped onions, salt, pepper and garlic together.
Roll the dough into a thin layer and cut into small circles.
Place a small amount of meat in the center of each circle of dough.
Fold the edges of the dough over the meat and bend the "points" together back along the fold to make a small ear shaped dumpling.
steps.description: If the folded dough doesn't stick moisten the edge of the dumpling with a little water to make them stick.

steps.headline: Boil the Pelmini in salted water until they float to the surface (~7 min).
Serve them in soup plates with butter, sour cream, or broth.
steps.description: Great as both a main dish or side.

text: To make the dough, combine the flour, eggs, water and a 1/2 teaspoon salt. Knead mixture. Mix the ground beef, ground pork, chopped onions, salt, pepper and garlic together.  Roll the dough into a thin layer and cut into small circles.  Place a small amount of meat in the center of each circle of dough.  Fold the edges of the dough over the meat and bend the "points" together back along the fold to make a small ear shaped dumpling. If the folded dough doesn't stick moisten the edge of the dumpling with a little water to make them stick. Boil the Pelmini in salted water until they float to the surface (~7 min).  Serve them in soup plates with butter, sour cream, or broth. Great as both a main dish or side. Enjoy!
